pullRequest.body:
For a sensible theory, we require that the centre of an algebra is closed under multiplication. The definition currently in Mathlib works for associative algebras, but not non-associative algebras. This PR uses the definition from Cabrera GarcÃ­a and RodrÃ­guez Palacios, which works for any multiplication (addition) and which coincides with the current definition in the associative case.

I did consider whether the centralizer should also be re-defined in terms of operator commutation, but this still results in a centralizer which is not closed under multiplication in the non-associative case. I have therefore retained the current definition, but changed `centralizer_eq_top_iff_subset` and `centralizer_univ` to only work in the associative case.

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
-->
- [ ] depends on: #8147

maintainer merge

I've looked at this too long and pushed too many tweaks to be comfortable merging it. Let's give someone else a few days to take a look, just in case I've missed something.

Thanks!

bors d+
This lemma is mis-named, it's not about `Subsemigroup` at all.

Did you mean
```suggestion
theorem _root_.Semigroup.mem_center_iff [Semigroup M] {z : M} :
    z âˆˆ Set.center M â†” âˆ€ g, g * z = z * g := by
```

This is going to be useless, because there are no `Decidable` instances about `IsMulCentral a`. You should either:
* Leave it for only the `Semigroup` case for now, perhaps with a TODO comment
* Add an `instance : Decidable (IsMulCentral a)` that takes `[âˆ€ a : M, Decidable <| âˆ€ b : M, b * a = a * b]` and three other decidable arguments

I doubt the second option is worth the effort, but the first option is easy and more useful than what you haev here.
Okay, I've done the first option.

I think the old proof
```suggestion
  exact (Commute.units_inv_right <| ha Â·)
```
would work here

style nit:
```suggestion
  mid_assoc b c := calc
```
(and in a few other places)
Can you add this to references.bib?
Oh nevermind, I somehow missed the line below.
I added the missing part in after you commented :) https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/6996/commits/c2f03f7eb24303e65848f842d0b8c49d1f6ce59b
Is this construction salvageable?
@eric-wieser I've got it to something that's much closer to the original now. I can't see a way to improve it further at the moment.
Presumably this should say "and associate"
Yes (and also in the additive docstring).

```suggestion
/-- The center of a magma is commutative and associative. -/
```
Isn't this now a duplicate of `Mul.center`? I think the `Subsemigroup.center` name is better, but indeed the docstring should change.
Yes, I've removed `Mul.center`.
Can you generalize `center` here to `NonassocSemiring`?
Yes, done.

```suggestion
  comm (a : M) : z * a = a * z
```

maybe:
```suggestion
/-- The center of a semiring `R` is the set of elements that commute and associate with everything in `R` -/
```

```suggestion
/-- The center of a non-associative semiring `R` is the set of elements that commute and associate with everything
```

This indent is pretty weird, and there are way too many parens here! I think it would be better as
```suggestion
    centralizer s = Set.univ â†” s âŠ† center M :=
  eq_top_iff.trans <| âŸ¨
    fun h _ hx => Semigroup.mem_center_iff.mpr fun _ => by rw [h trivial _ hx],
    fun h _ _ _ hm => (h hm).comm _âŸ©
```
Can you generalize to non-associativity in this file too?
Done in this commit https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/6996/commits/cde599ec206b40ab24ac54fec01a92e5f35b08ae
The `center.instNonUnitalCommRing` instance below should work in the `NonAssoc` case.
This instance is a less general version of the one above, right? I think it can be deleted.
Yes, I think you're right. Done.
I think it makes sense to move this further up the file to avoid needing to swap back and forth.
Hopefully I've now done what you wanted here. The flip side is that we now toggle in and out of namespaces.
I think things would be clearer with a separate `section Mul` and `section Semigroup`. Same in all the other `Center` files.
Fair enough. Done.
Can you add the theorem `IsMulCentral.left_comm` and `.right_comm` here to match `Commute.right_comm`? I think it will shorten some proofs.
Like this? https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/6996/commits/1ae3734783e49a1d70a9687196d0775c85136c54

We have a bit of a problem here; this forms an instance diamond:
```lean
example : center.commMonoid.toMonoid = (center M).toMonoid := rfl -- fails due to npow not matching
```
Perhaps the thing to do is make this a def, and for now only have the instances for the associative case.

(The `Subsemigroup` instance is safe, but everything downstream of this one is not)

I think you've resolved this now? (See also [Zulip discussion](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/144837-PR-reviews/topic/.236996.20Define.20the.20centre.20.2E.2E.2E.20for.20non-associative.20algebras) )
This should be deleted, it's leftover from a tricky merge
Done.

Formatting is a bit weird here:
```suggestion
    z âˆˆ Set.center A â†”
      (âˆ€ i, Commute (b i) z) âˆ§ âˆ€ i j,
        z * (b i * b j) = (z * b i) * b j
          âˆ§ (b i * z) * b j = b i * (z * b j)
          âˆ§ (b i * b j) * z = b i * (b j * z) := by
```
Can you use the `case` tactic to name these goals?
Done, thanks.

Since we're working with an associative `Group G` anyway, we can keep the old proof. Or is this purposefully more complicated for a potential nonassociative generalization?
```lean
  ext
  simp only [upperCentralSeries, upperCentralSeriesAux, upperCentralSeriesStep,
    Subgroup.mem_center_iff, mem_mk, mem_bot, Set.mem_setOf_eq]
  exact forall_congr' fun y => by rw [mul_inv_eq_one, mul_inv_eq_iff_eq_mul, eq_comm]
```
I've re-instated the old proof (with `center, Set.center,` replaced with `Subgroup.mem_center_iff` in `simp only` as you suggest).

```suggestion
      "The center of an addition with zero `M` is the set of elements that commute with everything in
```
